I am requesting an online session to relearn how to manipulate consumption curves. The context is I need to adjust consumption curves to simulate a weather event that I assumed to raise the demand of a specific multi-day time period by an amount that we calculate. I know we did this before, but I didn't use the knowledge and I need a refresh.
Next request is similar but related to the VPP models I am testing.

The previous scenario allowed me to apply a minimum output level to the buss/branch so the behind the buss generators would combine to produce this level. I understand how to do this and have successfully applied it to multiple scenarios. Thanks for the assistance.

The new issue is similar, but I need to change the minimum amount on an hourly basis. The VPP has a solar unit and a storage unit. I need the VPP to produce a minimum amount of electricity for specific hours and let the economics determine generation in the other hours. My first thought was to modify the solar curve to fit the new requirements, but I am not sure how that would work under a VPP.
[Created via e-mail received from: Michael Reed <mreed@texaspolicy.com>]

fields.summary: Questions about manipulating the demand side - TPPF

content.text: Can you put together a little bit of information for us to think about?
2. Hourly minimum generation for the VPP
3. Basic characteristics of the battery. Discharge size (MW) and storage
We'd need a few days, at least, but not necessarily a whole year.

> What I would like to do is set up a VPP with a solar or wind component

Subject: Re: Creating a New UPLAN Project
This message came from outside of Pattern. Be careful with links and attachments.

The first thing you need to do is upgrade to the latest UPLAN version (12.4.0.31510) that we sent to Pattern about 6 weeks ago. This is a minor upgrade from the one you're using (12.4.0.31324). The link and instructions are provided below.

Secondly you need to install one project in order to access UPLAN. We are about to send Pattern an email with a new project which also includes installation instructions. I have arranged for you to be copied on that email. Expect to see it in your inbox today or tomorrow.

Once that is completed, you will be able to launch UPLAN and you will see the installed project in the dropdown where there is now a red exclamation point. From this project you can create more new projects using "New Project" from the "File" menu in UPLAN. Also in UPLAN is a Help Guide which you can access from the "Help" menu.
Please download the UPLAN Altos setup from the below link:
Some important observations before beginning the installation process:
This version of UPLAN has updates with respect to the model and database schema. We strongly recommend making backups of SQL databases before upgrading.
We also recommend testing in your test environment before upgrading.
Do not uninstall your current UPLAN Altos application if you have a previous version installed, the setup will take care of upgrading your current version.

Do not overwrite any of the UPLAN Altos configuration files after the upgrade. The setup will preserve your previous settings and add additional parameters as needed. Overwriting any file after the upgrade may cause issues.
Make sure to close UPLAN Altos and exit the Powerstack agent before running the setup.
In the expanded Setup folder you will find, among others, the following important documents:
Uplan_Altos_Upgrade_Guide.pdf: has the detailed steps to perform the upgrade.
Uplan_Altos_Release_Notes.pdf: release notes for the new version.
RegCode.txt: has the registration license code.
1. Unzip and extract all the files.
2. Run the setup program selecting the 'Uplan Client / Powerstack Server' option from the expanded 'Setup\Client\' folder to upgrade the program components on UPLAN Altos client machine.
3. Make sure you have upgraded the databases before continuing, following the steps described in the next section below.
4. Try to access your patched projects from the upgraded machine. If everything went fine, proceed upgrading other UPLAN Altos client machines.
5. In the Powerstack cluster computer, run the 'Powerstack Cluster' installation of the UPLAN Altos setup

1. In order to apply the patches, it's very important to upgrade first one of the client computers to 12.4.0.31510 version and then apply patches using the updated Server Configuration Manager on that computer (after applying the database patches you may continue updating UPLAN on the rest of the computers).
2. Run the Server Configuration Manager from the upgraded machine, select 'Apply Patches', then select the patch file from the expanded Server\LCGMainPatch folder to patch your UPLAN Main Database.

3. Using the Server Configuration Manager, please apply this project patch first: Server\ProjectPatch\LCGProjPatch_IncrementalUpgrade_v7.4.9.1_TO_v12.4.0.31510.bpatch. This will upgrade your projects.
4. You may now upgrade the rest of the computers with the latest UPLAN Altos setup. Users can start using UPLAN Altos once they upgrade their client machine to 12.4.0.31510.
5. After the upgrade is done, open again server configuration to apply the 2nd project patch and allow it to run in the back-end: Server\ProjectPatch\LCGProjPatch_AfterUpgrade.patch

content.text: I exported a network from UPLAN for hour ending 18 and Oct 23, 2025, PJM model. The export itself is successful. But when I opened it, I encountered the following errors.

My Powerworld version is now 23. Can you help me on how to modify my UPlan scenario in order to export a network successfully without these errors? Due to these errors, I found that all transformers are not in my branch list in the exported raw file. I do have some buses with empty control area and control zone columns. But even after I created new areas and zones and tied these buses to them, I still got these errors and still could not see transformers in the raw file.

future release to address the issue.
